Never did a soul utter that cry unheeded. As the disciples grasp their oars to make a last effort, Jesus rises. He stands in the midst of His disciples, while the tempest rages. . . . He lifts His hand, so often employed in deeds of mercy, and says to the angry sea, "Peace, be still." . . . As Jesus rested by faith in the Father's care, so we are to rest in the care of our Saviour (The Desire of Ages, pp. 333-336).
